intro: Blakwellia brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stemmed blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round fruits. Blakwellia brachybotrys is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public spaces.
